gurmukhi: ieiq sRI bicqR nwtk kiRSnwvqwry ju`Du pRbMD KVg isMG bDih iDAwie smwpqm ]

transliteration: It(i) Sribachitra Naatak Karishnaavtdare Juddh(u) Prabandh Khadag Singh Badhah(i) Dhiaae Samaaptam||
translation: End of the Chapter entitled “Killing of Kharag Singh in Warfare” in Krishnavatara in Bachittar Natak.

gurmukhi: qau hI lau kop kIE muslI Air bIr qbY sMg qIr pHwry ] AYc lIey iek bwr hI bYrn pRwn ibnw kr BU pr fwry ]
transliteration: Tau Hilau Kop Mousliar(i) Beer Tabai San Teer Prahdare|| Aich Leee Ik Baar Hibairan Praan Binaa Kar Bhoo Par Ddare||
translation: Till that time, in great fury, Balram discharged his arrows and killed many enemies; pulling his bow he made many enemies lifeless and threw them on the ground;

gurmukhi: eyk blI gih hwQn so iCq pY kr kop iPrwie pCwry ] jIvq joaU bcy bl qy rn qXwg soaU niRp qIr isDwry ]1718]
transliteration: Ek Baligadh Haathan So Chhit Pai Kar Kop Pachhirdare|| Jeevat Jooo Bache Bal Te Ran Tyaag Sooo Nrip Teer Sidhdare||1718||
translation: He caught some of the mighty ones with his hands and knocked them down on the earth; those who survived from amongst them with their strength, they abandoned the war-arena and came before Jarasandh.1718.

gurmukhi: jrwisMD pY jwie pukwry ] KVg isMG rn BIqr mwry ] ieau suin kY iqn ky suK bYnw ] iris ky sMg Arun Bey nYnw ]1719]
transliteration: Jaraasindh Pai Jaae Poukdare|| Khadag Singh Ran Bheetar Mdare|| Io Soun(i) Kai Tin Ke Moukh Bainaa|| Ris(i) Ke San Aroun Bhae Nainaa||1719||
translation: Coming before Jarasandh, they said, “Kharag Singh has been killed in the war;” listening to their talk, his eyes became red with ire.1719.

gurmukhi: Apuny mMqRI sBY bulwey ] iqn pRiq BUpiq bcn sunwey ] KVg isMG jUJy rn mwhI ] Aaur suBt ko iqh sm nwhI ]1720]
transliteration: Apoune Mantrisabhai Bulaae|| Tin Prati Bhoopat(i) Bachanndsounaae|| Khadag Singh Joojhe Ran Maahee|| Aur Soubhat Ko Tih Sam Naahee||1720||
translation: He called all his ministers and said, “Kharag Singh has been killed in the battlefield and there is no other warrior like him.1720.

gurmukhi: KVg isMG so sUro nwhI ] iqh sm jwie lrY rn mwhI ] Ab qum kho kaun ibiD kIjY ] kaun suBt ko Awies dIjY ]1721]
transliteration: Khadag Singh So Sooro Naahee|| Tih Sam Jaae Darai Ran Maahee|| Ab Toum Kaho Kaoun Bidh(i) Keejai|| Kaoun Soubhat Ko Aais Deejai||1721||
translation: “There is no other warrior like Kharag Singh, who can fight like him; now you may tell me what should be done, and who should now be ordered to go?”1721.
Speech of the ministers addressed to Jarasandh:

gurmukhi: qb bolXo mMqRI sumq jrwisMD ky qIr ] swNJ prI hYN Ab niRpq kaun lry rnbIr ]1722]
transliteration: Tab Bolyo Mantrisoumat Jaraasindh Ke Teer|| Saanjh Pariparihain Ab Nripat Kaoun Dare Ranbeer||1722||
translation: Now the minister, Sumati by name, spoke to the king Jarasandh, “Now it is evening; who will fight at this time?”1722.

gurmukhi: auq rwjw cup hoie rhXo mMqiR khI jb gwQ ] ieq muslIDr qh gXo jhw huqy biRjnwQ ]1723]
transliteration: Out Raajaa Choup Hoe Rahyo Mantri Kahijab Gadth|| It Mousleedhar Tah Gado Jahaa Houte Brijnaath||1723||
translation: On that side, listening to the minister, the king sat down silently and on this side Balram reached there where Krishna was sitting.1723.
